Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Angels and the Chicago White Sox meet Thursday in MLB action from Guaranteed Rate Field.
This will be the final installment in a three-game series.
The Angels played the Houston Astros in their last series, losing the first three installments before a 9-8 win Sunday.
In the opener versus the Sox, the Angels took a 3-2 loss.
On Wednesday, LA lost 4-3 in extras.
Starter Jose Suarez lasted 5.0 innings with three earned runs.
In the starter slot for Thursday, the Angels are going with Tyler Anderson, who is 10-14 with a 3.70 ERA in 30 starts.
The Angels will play against the Rangers following this series.
The White Sox took a sweep versus the San Diego Padres in their last set, losing 3-2, 6-2, and 4-2.
On Wednesday, Chicago put up nine hits in the 10-inning victory.
Davis Martin gave up two earned runs in 3.2 frames as a starter.
Chris Flexen will start for the Sox on Thursday, with a record of 2-15 and a 5.15 ERA in 32 games (29 starts).
Eleven of the White Sox's last 12 day games against AL West opponents have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Each of the Angels' last four games as favorites have gone UNDER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the White Sox's last seven games as underdogs.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Angels' last four games as favorites against AL Central opponents.
